beginnerContent.audioExample: A'ole way I going do dat!

examples: No ack lidat in front aunty
Get plenny ackshun at da beach
You like come? Ainokea to me
Aiyah! I forgot my keys again
beginnerContent.audioExample: Aiyah, why you neva tell me?
You so akamai, can help me?

examples: Without glasses I stay all bline
beginnerContent.audioExample: I stay all bline in da dark

examples: He stay all buss from da party
beginnerContent.audioExample: I was all buss last night

examples: Da party was all nuts last night
Da food stay all pau already
beginnerContent.audioExample: We stay all pau wit da work

examples: Da party wen get all randle
He stay all salty about losing

beginnerContent.usage: Universal Hawaiian greeting showing love and respect

beginnerContent.audioExample: Can wear slippahs fo aloha friday
And then wat you going do?

examples: Ass right, das how we do um
Ass why I wen tell you
One big B-52 in da kitchen!
No do dat, going bring bachi
beginnerContent.audioExample: You going get bachi fo dat!

intermediateContent.usage: Food so good it "breaks your mouth"
intermediateContent.audioExample: Da kalua pig broke da mouth!
Chee hoo, da waves stay pumping!

examples: Pass me da kine ova dea
intermediateContent.audioExample: You know, da kine we wen use yesterday
Somebody wen steal my rubbah slippahs

examples: Ho, he saw da wave and wen get'um!
You see dat job posting? Get'um!
Da surf stay good, get'um brah!
intermediateContent.culturalNote: Encouragement to seize an opportunity with full commitment

examples: We wen talk story and buss laff
His joke made me buss laff
Da whole class wen buss laff
intermediateContent.culturalNote: To laugh so hard you might 'bust' from laughter

examples: Dat story made me bust 'em up
We was busting 'em up all night
His dancing made everyone bust 'em up
intermediateContent.culturalNote: Even more intense than 'buss laff' - laughing so hard you're broken up
Hawaiian exclamation expressing shock, dismay, or sympathy
Pidgin pronunciation of 'guarantee' used as emphasis

examples: Small kid time, I used to play marbles
Small kid time was so fun
We did dat all da time, small kid time
intermediateContent.culturalNote: Nostalgic phrase referring to one's childhood memories

examples: He stay ballah head since young time
My bruddah going ballah head like daddy
intermediateContent.culturalNote: Casual way to describe someone who is bald

intermediateContent.pidgin: eh, you stay wit' da kine?
english: hey, are you with that thingamajig?
intermediateContent.pronunciation: EH, you STAY wit dah KYNE
examples: Eh, you stay wit' da kine we wen talk about?
You stay wit' da kine or wat?
Ho, you still stay wit' da kine from yesterday?
intermediateContent.usage: Used when you can't remember the word for something specific
intermediateContent.culturalNote: Perfect example of 'da kine' versatility in Pidgin conversation

examples: No talk stink about my cousin
She stay talk stink about everybody
intermediateContent.usage: Speaking negatively about someone behind their back
intermediateContent.culturalNote: Common phrase warning against gossip in local communities

examples: Dat no good, go mo' bettah
Try again, go mo' bettah dis time
You can go mo' bettah than dat
intermediateContent.usage: Encouraging someone to improve or do something better

english: thank you for hooking me up!
examples: Mahalo, for da hookup with da job!
Mahalo, for da hookup with your cousin
Ho, mahalo for da hookup with da tickets!
intermediateContent.usage: Thanking someone for a favor, connection, or helping you get something
intermediateContent.culturalNote: Shows appreciation for someone's help in connecting you to opportunities

examples: Get choke people at da beach today
We get choke work fo' do
intermediateContent.usage: Indicating there's a large amount or many of something
intermediateContent.culturalNote: Pidgin way of saying 'plenty' or 'a lot'

english: to play a joke on someone
examples: He stay make funny with his sister
Stop make funny, I stay serious
intermediateContent.culturalNote: Light-hearted teasing, usually among friends or family

examples: We need da kine, da whole kine for da party
He brought da kine, da whole kine setup
Get da kine, da whole kine ready?
intermediateContent.usage: Referring to everything related to something, the complete set
intermediateContent.culturalNote: Shows how 'da kine' can be expanded for emphasis

intermediateContent.pidgin: no can, da buggah stay broke
intermediateContent.pronunciation: NO can, dah BUG-gah stay BROKE
examples: You like use my car? No can, da buggah stay broke
Can fix da computer? No can, da buggah stay broke
No can help you, da buggah stay broke
intermediateContent.usage: Explaining that you can't do something because the item/tool is broken
intermediateContent.culturalNote: Common explanation combining inability with broken equipment

english: doing something on purpose but making it look accidental
examples: He wen spill his drink accidentally on purpose to get her attention
advancedContent.audioExample: He wen do dat accidentally on purpose, I know!

examples: Da road stay all jam up
advancedContent.audioExample: Town stay all jam up today

examples: I get beer in my ear, no can hear
advancedContent.audioExample: Talk louder, I get beer in my ear
Look at dose cho cho lips

examples: You going choke your neck wit mom
advancedContent.audioExample: Going choke your neck if you late
Das why hard fo learn pidgin

examples: E komo mai to our hale
How you figgah he did dat?
I no kid you, was real
advancedContent.audioExample: I no kid you, he stay lolo

advancedContent.pidgin: if can can if no can no can
examples: Help me out - if can can, if no can no can
advancedContent.audioExample: Try come - if can can, if no can no can

examples: In oddah words, you no like

advancedContent.audioExample: Suck em up before we go

examples: Da white kukui blossom stay beautiful
Wop yo jaw, I said so!
He wen bust his board, yeah you?
Da traffic was bad, yeah you!
Yeah you, dat's exactly what happened
advancedContent.culturalNote: Way to affirm or seek affirmation, unique Pidgin phrase structure

advancedContent.pidgin: ho, da bagah's goin' chicken skin!
english: wow, that guy is getting goosebumps!
advancedContent.pronunciation: HO, dah BAG-ah's goin CHICK-en skin
examples: Ho, da bagah's goin' chicken skin from da scary story
Look da bagah, goin' chicken skin from da cold
Da bagah wen go chicken skin when he heard da music
advancedContent.usage: Observing someone getting goosebumps or chills
